alert.note: Alert for Northern Elko County; South Central Elko County; Southern Lander County and Southern Eureka County; Southwest Elko County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 14 at 4:41PM PST by NWS Elko
info.description: ...Snow through tonight across central and northeastern Nevada... A weather disturbance will bring snow to many of the higher valleys across central and northeastern Nevada through tonight. Snow levels of 5500 feet will drop to around 5000 feet tonight resulting in snow accumulation of 1 to 2 inches by Sunday morning. Higher snow amounts of 2 to 4 inches are expected along higher roadways and passes including Pequop summit and some areas along SR-225 north of Elko. Prepare for reduced visibility in heavier snow along with slick roads through the night as temperatures fall below freezing. Snow showers are expected to diminish in intensity and coverage early Sunday morning. Motorists should remain alert to quickly changing weather and road conditions, and reduce speeds over snow covered roadways. Visit www.weather.gov/elko for the latest weather information.
